category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: D.1.2 Cloud-Edge-IoT Demand Landscape
result.description: This report will provide a comprehensive and detailed analysis of the actual and potential demand ecosystem of Cloud-Edge-IoT, starting with a baseline report based on desk research and a custom survey in m.6, with updates every 6 month. The report will feed into the dialogue with stakeholders and contribute to the scenarios developed in WP2.

result.title: D.2.1 Readiness Framework and Service Requirements
result.description: Readiness framework establishes a common structure for exploring CEI market dynamics. Service requirements provide a baseline against which suppliers can benchmark their planned offerings. Initial draft of D.2.1 ready in M6 to support Wave 1 Workshops and finalized in M12 to support Wave 2 Workshops with Value Chain Adopter Groups.

result.title: D3.3 Report on CEI Service Requirements
result.description: The results of the workshops will be analysed and sanitized to create a public report, with a detailed analysis of cross-domain similarities and differences, any unique business or service requirements by domain, key factors influencing relative preferences between offerings and alternative market scenarios, and preliminary indications of framework and enabling conditions required to motivate creation of market scenarios that would may offer advantages for European sovereignty and autonomy in the CEI marketplace. A draft handout of the report will be submitted at M18.

result.title: Boundary conditions and feedback regional and basin scale WEFE models
result.description: This deliverable will describe the results of task 3.3. It will describe the interlinkages created between the global, regional and basin-scale models in order to use the outputs of the global and continental-scale WEFE models as boundary conditions for the basin-scale models. Additionally, this deliverable will describe the findings that may result from confronting global and continental-scale results against basin-scale data and model results to assess the reliability of the global WEFE models. The target audiences are the GoNEXUS partners, in particular those working on river basin WEFE modelling, and scientists working on river basin WEFE modelling. It will be used in Task 4.3
